intro: Creusa revolvens, commonly known as the twisting creusa, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spirally twisted stems and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Creusa revolvens thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
